string-array.item: API
ALU
ASCII
AAC
BIU
BCD

CC

string-array.name: abbreviations_list_child
string-array.item: Application Programming Interface \n\nIn Computer Programming,an application programming interface is a set of subroutine,definitions,protocols and tools for building application software.
Arithmetic Logic Unit \n\nAn arithmetic logic unit is a combinational digital electronic circuit that performs arithmetic and bitwise operations on integer binary numbers.
American Standard Code for Information Interchange \n\nASCII is a character encoding standard for electronic.
Advanced Audio Coding \n\nAdvanced Audio Coding is a proprietary audio coding standard for lossy digital audio compression.
Bus Interface Unit \n\nThe BIU provides various functions,including generation of the memory and I O addresses for the transfer of data between outside the CPU and the EU.

Binary Coded Decimal \n\nIn computing and electronic systems,binary coded decimal is a class of binary encodings of decimal numbers where each decimal digit is represented by a fixed number of bits,usually four or eight.
High level programming language \n\nBASIC is a family of general purpose,high level programming languages whose design philosophy emphasizes ease of use.

Basic Input Output system \n\nFor IBM PC compatible computers,BIOS is non volatile firmware used to perform hardware initialization during the booting process and to provide runtime services for operating systems and programs.
Carbon Copy \n\nCarbon Copy is an email that is copied to one or more recipients.
Computer Assisted Instruction \n\nCAI is a program of instructional material presented by means of a computer or computer systems.
Computer Aided Design \n\nCAD is the use of computer systems to aid in the creation,modification,analysis or optimization of a design.
Cascading Style Sheets \n\nCSS is a style sheet language used designing the presentation of a document written in a markup language.
Clock Cycles Per Instruction \n\nCPI is one aspect of a processors performance.The average number of clock cycles per instruction for a program or program fragment.
Dots Per Inch \n\nDPI is a measure of spatial printing or video or image scanner dot density,in particular the number of individual dots that can be placed in a line within the span of 1 inch.

Digital Video Recorder \n\nA digital video recorder is an electronic device that records video in a digital format to a disk drive,USB flash drive,SD memory card,SSD or other local or networked mass storage device.
Electronic Data Interchange \n\nElectronic data interchange is the concept of businesses communicating electronically certain information that was traditionally communicated on paper.
Graphical User Interface \n\nA graphical user interface is a human computer interface,a way for humans to interact with computers that uses windows,icons and menus.
Hypertext Transfer Protocol \n\nHTTP is an application protocol for distributed,collaborative and hypermedia in formation systems.
Internet Protocol address \n\nAn Internet Protocol address is a numerical label assigned to each device connected to a computer network that uses the internet Protocol for communication.

Java Development Kit \n\nThe Java Development Kit is an implementation of either one of the Jave Platform,Standard Edition,Java Platform,Enterprise Edition,or Java Platform,Micro Edition plateforms released by oracle.
Java Virtual Machine \n\nA Java Virtual Machine is an abstract computing system machine that enables a computer to run a Java program.
Java Runtime Environment \n\nThe Java Runtime Environment is a set of software tools for development of Java applications a Runtime Environment.
Uniform Resource Locator \n\nUniform Resource Locator is a form of URL and is a standardized naming convention for addressing documents accessible over the Internet.
